title: A Study of the Effect of Concomitant Administration of Rifampin on the Pharmacokinetics of BMS-708163 in Healthy Subjects
description_brief: The purpose of the study is to determine if the concomitant administration of rifampin with BMS-708163 will affect the Pharmacokinetics of BMS-708163 and to assess safety and tolerability of co-administration BMS-708163 and rifampin
explanation_target: Reason: The trial tests BMS-708163, which is a small-molecule gamma-secretase inhibitor developed to reduce amyloid-β production (i.e., targeting Alzheimer’s pathology/disease-modifying mechanism). citeturn0search0turn0search4

Act: Key extracted details — drug: BMS-708163 (avagacestat); mechanism: selective γ-secretase inhibitor targeting Aβ synthesis; trial described is a drug–drug interaction/PK study of concomitant rifampin with BMS-708163 (NCT01002079). citeturn0search4turn0search6turn1search5

Reflect: Classification check — avagacestat is a small-molecule inhibitor aimed at Alzheimer’s pathological mechanism (amyloid production), so it fits the definition of 'disease-targeted small molecule' rather than a biologic, cognitive enhancer, or symptom-management intervention. No ambiguity in the mechanism from the sources; therefore the assigned category is appropriate. citeturn0search0turn0search3

explanation_agent: Reason: The investigational drug BMS-708163 (avagacestat) is a small‑molecule γ‑secretase inhibitor developed to reduce production of amyloid‑β peptides (Aβ) by inhibiting APP cleavage, i.e., it directly targets the amyloid production pathway. citeturn0search4turn0search2turn1search6

Act: Extracted details — drug: BMS‑708163 (avagacestat); mechanism: selective γ‑secretase inhibitor that lowers Aβ40/Aβ42 in CSF and plasma; trial type: a pharmacokinetic / drug–drug interaction study assessing concomitant rifampin with BMS‑708163 (NCT01002079). These details support classification under the CADRO category for amyloid‑beta. citeturn1search6turn1search3turn0search4

Reflect: Classification check — the intervention’s primary biological focus is inhibition of γ‑secretase to reduce Aβ production, which maps specifically to CADRO category A) Amyloid beta (not to inflammation, tau, synaptic plasticity, etc.). No evidence in the description that the trial is multi‑target or non‑therapeutic, so 'A) Amyloid beta' is the appropriate category. citeturn0search4turn0search2
